blogs.title: Working woman’s dilemma: Freeze your eggs or freeze your career?
blogs.summary: If you're a woman in your late twenties or beyond, if you have no serious life partner, or if you are in a relationship but you're not ready to start a family, egg freezing might be for you? Is it worth the risks, medical and financial?

blogs.title: Freezing Your Eggs is Much Harder Than You Realize
blogs.summary: We know how to successfully freeze, store, and thaw human sperm. We’re still on a learning curve with human eggs. Abby Rabinowitz’s recent feature at Nautilus explores the all-too limited statistics about how well the process works and the data

news.title: A startup founded by SolarCity and Google alums wants to tell you your 'fertility age' — here's what that means
news.summary: In the US, women are waiting longer than ever to have children. In 2014, the average age of first birth in the US was 26.3, up from 24.9 in 2000, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

news.title: There's a 'looming healthcare crisis for the millennial generation' — and it's just getting started
news.summary: People who decide to start their families later are contributing to a "looming healthcare crisis for the millennial generation." That's according to Claire Tomkins, founder and CEO of the startup Future Family told Business Insider.
